task.title: Specify the Data Processing Function
task.shortdesc: To associate a Data Processing Function (DPF) with a data collection, you upload the DPF archive onto the Data Processing Function screen of the Data Collections page.

p.xref: Tell me about DPFs and DPF archives.

context.p: To associate a DPF with a data collection:

step.cmd: On the Data Policy screen of the Data Collections page, click the Data Processing Function tab.
step.info: The Data Processing Function screen opens. When you first define a data collection, no DPF is associated with it.

step.cmd: Click the Add a DPF button.
step.info: The Apply DPF for this Data Collection screen opens.

step.cmd: Choose to use either a System DPF or a Custom DPF.

choices.choice: A system DPF is one of the standard DPF libraries provided with . If you choose System DPF, use the drop-down arrow to select which PHEMI system DPF you want to use. Choose between a DPF for processing Variant Call Format (VCF) data and a DPF for processing Microsoft Excel workbook data. Once the system DPF is selected, click the Apply System DPF button to apply the DPF.

A custom DPF is a DPF you develop especially to process your organization's data. If you choose Custom DPF, click the Select File button, navigate to the DPF archive and double-click the ZIP file. Or, drag and drop the DPF archive from your file manager oto the target area on the screen. Click the Apply Custom DPF button to upload the archive file and apply the DPF.

info.p: The system uploads the DPF, validates it, and applies it. The Data Processing Function screen reappears, showing the DPF name, the DPF version, the default trigger condition, and the DPF description. All information except the trigger is automatically read from the DPF archive or derived by 's .

step.cmd: Set the trigger condition. The trigger condition determines when the DPF processes ingested data.

chdesc.p: The DPF processes data as it is ingested.
The DPF must be manually triggered.
When you choose this option, an Execute button appears next to the Trigger field. Click this button to manually execute a DPF on a data collection.
The DPF executes on ingested data according to the specified schedule. When you choose this option, a scheduling field appears.
Set the DPF schedule to execute every 1 minute, 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 30 minutes, or 60 minutes. By default, the DPF executes every 5 m

step.info: By default, the DPF trigger is set to execute the DPF every 5 minutes.
